intro: Coeloglossum viride var. thuringiacum, commonly known as the Thuringian green helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, humus-filled soil. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its ability to form dense colonies in suitable habitats. Coeloglossum viride var. thuringiacum is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
